author: {'steamid': '76561199087279244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 7511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7475, 'last_played': 1696922566}
review: This is a peculiar game. There is an interesting simplicity & depth to it. I like to compare it to the inventions of table-top games such as chess or checkers, but more... Sci-fi themed. This game is competitive & requires tactical thinking, applying various strategies & adapting. There are no active players, so you would have to find someone to play with manually, or play against the AI, which can be a difficult challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011250864', 'num_games_owned': 1900, 'num_reviews': 359, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1621095338}
review:
An interesting strategy game.

You need to gain over 75% control of the map in order to win. To do that your Interloper just has to cross the area, all the while capturing strategic objectives and using various units to your advantage against the enemy.

Campaign is designed to introduce you to the mechanics and doesnt pose much of a challenge. After that you can either play skirmish or multiplayer or the various maps. There is no story.

Im pretty sure there is more depth to it, but that can only be realized in a competitive multiplayer environment.  But since the multiplayer is dead, all thats left is the skirmish mode. Its fine, it has 13 maps and the AI can be a bit tricky, so there is some gameplay to be had.

Since there is no price tag anymore, there is no barrier to trying it out. But for single player Im not sure its worth the time investment.

5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198243032868', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 884, 'last_played': 1699729188}
review:
This game is fantastic and it's a shame it's so underrated, the visuals are great, the gameplay is great and the audio (both sound effect and music) is great (though there's something off about it, not sure how to describe it) and it's free so there's really no reason to not give it a try. 
The objective of the game is to take 75% of territory, which you do by moving your "mothership" into new territory, this unit is indestructible can block the oponent and can turn invisible but there's only one so where you send it to is a crutial parrt of the game. Do you send it to take territory and leave yourself vulnerable or leave it defending an important lane and be unable to expand?
There are 3 structures you'll want to take, an energy source that powers the other structures, a unit factory that makes basic units and a foundry that turns basic units into advanced ones, the last 2 are invulnerable when powered and block the oponent so they will try and take your energy sources or disconect them from the sources by surrounding them with their territory (power goes through territory).
You have 1 "basic" unit and 3 "advanced" units you can make, the basic unit is an all rounder, it can be used offensively and defensibly but it's not great at either as it has 1 health and dies when it attacks something. The first advanced unit is the defender which has 3 health despite being made from 2 basic units but can't attack at all so it's good at holding key postions especialy when paired with the sniper but can't do much else. Easily being the strongest unit in the game is the sniper, it has 1 health despite needing 3 units to make but it easily makes up for it with it's ability to shoot units from an unlimited distance. It can only shoot once though before needing to recharge. this unit is exellent in both the defensive and the offensive as they are really good at holding lanes at no cost once it's built though you may need defenders to protect them. lastly we have the attacker units that cost 4 basic units and has 3 health and it can spend 2 of these on an attack after which it needs to recharge and only has 1 health. this unit is kinda lackluster though as it is more expensive than a sniper but far less effective than it as it's attack is only 2 (not even enough to kill a defender) has one health when recharging so you have to escort it with a defender which costs 2 more units on top of the very expensive 4 units you need to make it. it really needs a buff like having 3 attack power or costing 3 units or making it have always 3 health even when recharging, something that makes it better because right now it's a really niche unit and you'll barely make them.
Unfortunately no one plays this game which means that once you can beats bots you'll have to find someone if you want to keep playing which isn't that hard to do since it's free but still. (you can play against me if you want)
Either way you really should just give it a try since it's free and really good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138116172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1594196876}
review: Really easy to learn, but don't let that deceive you -- there are an infinite number of ways to use your units, and the tide of the game can be easily turned by experienced players so you're always on edge. My only complaint is that even with the handicaps, the hardest level AI (expert) isn't too bad once you get to know how to use the various types of units (expert AI is really hard though if there is no forge available).

author: {'steamid': '76561198025052473', 'num_games_owned': 1071, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1707014372}
review: Simple, quick and minimalistic RTS. The point of the game is to win, and you do so by owning most of the map. you have your main unit, it is invincible, can block enemy units, and capture structures and most importantly, capture the map where ever it moves. this is your most important unit. you get other units as you play which offer various strategic options and help you put pressure. most games will take about 5 minutes. there are 5 different kind of units, keeping it simple. and a dozen of maps. this game is free, but old, and no longer has a multiplayer community. but it has good bots, and a short campaign. worth a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995730646', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 4255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4255, 'last_played': 1567965817}
review:
Que se puede decir de este juego,,,, dejame ver,,,,,, son dos jugadores enfrentados por dominar el mapa y sus recursos. Tipico de un RTS. La novedad es que gana el que mas mapa llegue a conquistar. Tiene unidades interesantes, la IA se pone complicada pero una vez que encuentras como derrotarla te pide perdon por existir y se arrodilla ante ti.

Ahora a tomar en cuenta:

â–¶ Es un buen juego, enfrentar a la computadora te dara horas de entretenimiento.
â–¶ La comunidad para jugar multiplayer esta TOTALMENTE MUERTA. No existe.
â–¶ Jugando contra la IA, si tu no mueves, la IA tampoco se mueve. Entonces juego bloqueado. Deberia de tener un contador en tiempo para obligar a los jugadores a mover.
â–¶ El juego posee como 15 mapas. Pero dichos mapas no son aleatorios. Osea que siempre sera el mismo. Trazas tu estrategia en el mapa y listo No habrÃ¡n sorpresas.

[b] Lo VolverÃ­a a Jugar:[/b] No.

[h1] M3gatr0m [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198260196031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1609047630}
review: I was looking for some fun games I could play offline, single player, and found Interloper. Although I do not have a lot of time in the game yet, I really like it! The game runs with no problems on my Linux Ubuntu machine. The graphics are fresh and appealing. I like the modern, yet natural themes. The game play is fun; strategic yet simplistic. I also got this game for free, which I am grateful for. Thank you to the developers. : )

review: Awesome game. Planing ahead, taking mapcontrol and being creative is the main aspect of this game. The AI knows very well what to do to make your life as hard as possible and offers quite the challenge. Pick it up if youre a fan of strategie games and because it is free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008224789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1533281666}
review:
Literally an unplayable game. I've played League of Legends, PUBG, Fortnite, Heroes of the Storm, and so many other games that are graphically intensive, but never in my life have I encountered so many crashes relating to graphical errors until I got to this game. I couldn't even enter Singleplayer or Multiplayer! On top of that, trying to ALT+F4, CTRL+ALT+DELETE, CTRL+SHIFT+ESCAPE, or even using TASK MANAGER became a futile effort to try to close the game and it locked my entire computer up, forcing me to restart it rather than just closing the game like any other.

I understand its free, but that doesn't excuse it having so many issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112139289', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1529693635}
review:
I've seen people complain about bugs, but it haven't occured a single one for me, and let me tell ya, this is not necessarily a bad game. 

It's a decent strategy game with 3 differend buildings, 4 different units, 1 special ability your Sentinel (your main unit) can do, and depending on which units you build you can either win or loose. A nice, relatively simple little strategy game, that is easy to learn, even if you skip the tutorial (don't do that though).

The worst thing about the game is that nobody is playing it, so you can't find online matches (unless you're playing with friends) and since it's a free game, there's nothing to worry about. Give it a try

review:
>free
>pretty
>fast games (rarely more than 5 mins)
>high APM (make sure to rebind shortcuts to select everything easily, meaning almost no need to use left click)
>perfect balance, so perfect that it is possible to reach stalemates (at least on maps without special units)
>very deep game, the different special units allow for many approaches and one can also speak of openings (like in chess)

give it a shot :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197972275625', 'num_games_owned': 565, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1710308452}
review:
Dont be put off by the low, low price - this is a great game. Really scratches the RTS itch - but the games are short. Also its really pretty.

5 different units with very different impact on the battelfield. Need to capture territory, bases and supply.

Kind of chess-meets-rts.

Bought it when it was cheap and now i feel bad for ripping the devs off :P  Its really worth more than a buck. Buy it and buy some for your mates.  And hope these devs make another game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078437944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1607634417}
review:
This game is a very nice RTS with a unique idea that has been put into scene by a lovely graphic design.
Beat your opponent by  "owning" 75% of the maps area. Which can be really hard, at least against the AI because that one is very tough.
Which brings me to a con and that is that theres hardly anyone playing it so basically all I ever did was play agains AI. But the idea is very nice and now its reduced to 1 euro permanently so go ahead and try it!!
Hope we can re-vitaliate the playerbase.
Not sure if writing a review helps to spread the knowledge about this game but I hope it does. So here we go ADVERT for this game! I do recommend, even against AI it can be very nice playing some games but even awesomer would be against other players online :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198217824319', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1604725773}
review:
Since the game is now free and the download and doesn't take up much space on your hard drive you should just try it. Its a fun game that can keep you entertained for a few hours. The company that made the game closed down when they made the game free, so if you happen to get one of the game breaking bugs that some people in other reviews metion, then unfortunately there won't be any fix for the game. Other than that, the game is really solid, although there is not that much content.

The design of the game is really simple, but it also surprisingly deep. You have access to 4 types of units that have distinct roles and I found it necessary to make all of them in every game. It's not the lazy kind of RTS where every unit does the same thing just with more health and/or damage.

The gameplay is really well thought out and balanced. The goal of the game is to capture 75 percent of the territory on the map, which you do by using your Sentinal unit. The sentinal can capture territory and structures by moving over it, but it cannot attack or move through enemy units (or be killed/damaged). This means you have to use other units to attack enemy units and clear pathways, as well as block the enemy sentinal from moving through territory, at least until they send units to attack yours.

The multiplayer seems to have been shut down and does not work anymore unfortuately, so the only content left is the campaign and skirmish missions. The expert difficulty ai, which is the highest level ai in skirmish mode, is a decent challenge and can easily exploit your mistakes. You have to manipulate the ai into do something stupid if you want to beat the expert ai, especially if you give yourself one of the handicaps. One tip i can give is if you get the AI stuck in a game of chicken, where both sentinals are right next to each other and waiting for the other to move, use that time to gain an advantage. Play passively at that point to avoid provoking it into moving and get units like snipers that you can use to cause attrition to the AI's units. You can go back on the offensive once you've built up units and created a winning position.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989491394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1590249023}
review:
Pie goes like this:

Long story short: 1. Beautiful design. 2.Campaign pretty easy until you reach the last 2 levels or so; 3. Achievements probably impossible to make. 4. Multiplayer doesn't work.

I don't remember buying this game but since I discovered it in my library and looked cute enough to give a try, so I did. The design is simply wonderful, I love everything about it: the colors, the movement, every element (except the ship maybe, 's kinda weird) so it gets 10/10 from me. But after 4h trying to finish the campaign, there's not too much left of it. You can change the difficulty and lose your shit because no matter what handicap you choose, you still get your ass kicked. Multiplayer doesn't actually work but there's something interesting enough..watching other's people replays..?! 

I really want to recommend this..but no.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061337029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1708528917}
review:
**EDIT**
I must say, as frustrated as I was with this game, and how willing I was to just walk away from it forever, I gave it another chance after the dev contacted me (quite quickly, I must ad. I am actually very impressed with the speed of their response. In my own opinion, that shows me the devs really care about the game experience they are creating.)

Anyway, I followed the instructions given, and the short version is.....the game is working. 
I am currently running the singleplayer campaign to get the full experience. 
Still, I am on the fence about if I am enjoying this or if it is more determination to get through it, and with that said, I am changing my recommendation. 

I would say give the game a chance. Don't let my starting negative sway your mind. It's not for everyone, but with it working, it is well put together. 


+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
This game is some serious garbage. I would not recommend purchasing unless you like being frustrated. 
Was playing the campaign, to learn the game and give it a solid chance, and learn the rules. Honest first few hours attempt at playing here. 
But when the game blatantly ignores the rules, bypasses one-way passages, and virtually makes it impossible to play or even beat, what is the point? I watched the so-called"one-way" passage be pushed through like it was not there. On top of that, my source has been pushed out of its own area, as if standing in a single spot for strategy purposed "annoyed the game" (I know that sounds like a paranoid statement, but when the A.I. pushes you out of your own spot against what the training and rules say, there is something wrong here). 
Honestly, keep your few dollars, do not purchase this garbage, and do not waste your time on it. Spend time on a game that is actually rewarding(no, I will not give any titles here, I try to be fair and will not name drop something). 
The bottom line is the frustration with something that is supposed to be simple, but cannot deliver and will not hold up to its own in game rule system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198238341396', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1496805652}
review:
i'm really glad I was able to get this game at such a low discount. It was worth every pennie. But 11.99 regular priced? thats a bit much even for this game. Don't get me wrong I loved everything about it, but there was only so much to love in the first place. The game play is great, simple controls, easy to pick up game play and the challenge of a puzzle. That being said, its essentially a mobile app game on steriods. This could totally be played on a phone, the premise is so simple and the challenge is great too. but thats it. once I beat the last guy in the "campaign" I tried to go multiplayer and it didn't even work. no body else is playing this I guess. kinda sucks cause I really was looking forward to muliplayer too. 

What this boils down to is that its a great game thanks make you think differently, tactfully. but that game is essentially a mobile app game only on your computer, and is $11.99. If its on sale, grab it, it will be a nice adition to your collection. Other than that, Meh..

author: {'steamid': '76561198054560875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 4814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2679, 'last_played': 1642093697}
review:
After watching the trailer, I immediately realized that this is a very interesting and concrete project. Without thinking twice, I bought and rejoiced, because it weighs only 300 mb.
I downloaded, I was happy again, I began to receive training. But later, realizing that this is the whole beauty of the game, I was stuck and continued to master the complex management (well, that there are hotkeys). The first thing I would like to say is that this is a very long and detailed training in many stages and battles with the computer. Each explanation is accompanied by a mini-game where you dictate to study new techniques and new "objects", which in the future you will fight. These "objects" you have to create with the help of the barracks, which, in turn, feed on special sources of energy. There are several types of "items": some - ordinary pawns, other guards, third strong fighters, and the rest - excellent snipers. Even in the game there is an object that allows heroes only in one direction, which makes the battle even worse.
After several such explanations, you get into the game using a computer, where you need, with the help of the aforementioned "assistants", to grab the necessary number of fields. Over time, things get complicated. Of course, you can follow exactly the same way as your opponent, but that will not be enough to win. You will need to create a brain opening tactic (or simply) with which you will win.
Plus enough in this game. The first plus is the idea itself, the second is unconditionally graphic, because it relaxes, and the third plus is the soundtrack, the fourth and fifth are gameplay and entertainment with friends, because the battles in this game, especially with a friend, are quite spectacular.
But in this game there are minuses. For an inexperienced player, there are "protracted" situations when playing with bots. That is, the effect of the slogan "our rounds lasts no more than 5 minutes" in such situations collapses due to the fact that you can get into a tactical or strategic stupor. The game is very well balanced, you can not crush the enemy by the farm, you will be saved only by competent tactics, which at some moments can reduce the dynamics, causing the player to "slow down" the action and think about the next move in the game, and thus the round can drag on 10-15 minutes. It all depends on the ingenuity of the player. But experience in the game as a result can deny this flaw.
Some of them may call the controversial setting of the game - a kind of fantastic "underwater" or "bioworld" is at first a little scary, as long as the player gets used to the mechanics of the game.
Interloper - a good network puzzle with unusual gameplay, suitable for the break.
With all this, the game dragged me over 51 hours. But for those who just want to spend time pleasantly, I advise you to immediately copy several packages to yourself and friends. Due to the fact that I can not immediately find a network fight 9.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198238273934', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1589049180}
review:
I got it for a big introduction discount and it is definitely worth it. If it is worth the full price you have to decide for yourself. It's a question of how much you get for your money but what you get is very good.

+ very innovative game idea
+ finished and working game
+ good casual game, but also great challanges for "hard core gamers"
+ nice graphics and artwork
+ game is simple but offers room for quite some cool winning strategies

- (I'm playing on a mac) fullscreen dosent works (Game freezes) first time you installed you must manually lower your graphics settings (Thanks to Dev for communicating with me)
- (a small minus) maybe the controls of the units (selection+giving commands) could sometimes be better

author: {'steamid': '76561198135989477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1485039000}
review:
A brilliant RTS board game, with a nice presentation.

It's minimal and with a straight forward concept. You can finish the tutorial and learn all the mechanics within an hour, however it can take quite a while to actually wrap your head around it and do everything in real time.

The visuals, audio, and overall atmosphere is pretty relaxing, but at the end of the day, this is still a micro-heavy RTS game, so it can get really intense.

You have to control your main unit to capture map territory while also juggling with 4 different types of sub-units with effects like path blocking or lane clearing. There's also unit-producing nests, unit-converting nests, and power generators to power your nests. So it's an area control game, with lots of multitasking between all the different units and tasks at hand, while also trying to counter your opponent.

There's about 10 different maps to play which adds to the variety of possible scenarios and strategies.

This game has online multiplayer, however all servers are dead. So if you want to play this with actual people, get the 2-pack and find a friend to play it with.

Great game if you're willing to invest the time to master it.
Matches play fast so it's definitely recommended for RTS fans who want to take a quick break and practice their micro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138271158', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1558801933}
review:
This game is pretty good despite it's popularity at the moment. Not a whole lot of players play multiplayer.

It is very simpel and easy to understand. The campaign guide you very well and it guide you over the neccessary aspact of the game. But it is hard to master.
Every match is fast paced and only the quick thinker can win. A normal match only last for 5 min.

The maps give you equal advantages and does not favor the other. At the moment, the game doesn't have a free map tool to create new maps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138783151', 'num_games_owned': 6327, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1472499723}
review:
[b]Interloper is a fast-paced real-time strategy game that features stunning visuals and very simple mechanics. The only objective of this game is to claim more territory than your enemy.[/b]

You can play in single-player (single match or campaign) or multiplayer. However, there arenâ€™t enough players online so, unfortunately, multiplayer is dead.

During the campaign there will be a tutorial to teach you the mechanics of this game: 
- your goal is to conquer 75% of the territory on the map. To achieve that you control a sentinel. You claim territory by moving it to unclaimed areas or enemy territory. 
- although sentinels cannot fight, they can claim assemblers that produce drones. These can fight enemiesâ€™ drones. To produce drones a power source is needed. 
- drones can be upgraded, through foundries, to stronger units - Specialist Units- such as Snipers, Defenders or Destroyers.

Despite multiplayer being dead, I still recommend this game since it does not overstay its welcome: the mechanics can be learned easily and all matches are fast and end quite quickly (they usually don't take longer than a couple of minutes).

review:
I purchased two copies of this game to play with my son.  My copy loads up, but then when I try to start level 1 it crashes every time.  My son's copy just won't start.
Two completely different computers (Dell laptop and Vibox desktop) and all our other games are working just fine.
Early access I could almost understand, but this is a launched game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062232099', 'num_games_owned': 5821, 'num_reviews': 291, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1471144931}
review:
[h1]What is Interloper?[/h1]

Monogon Games are the developers behind Interloper that saw its release on 21 May 2016. The game is an RTS in its most pure form. The primary objective of the game is to gain control of each map. There are both single-player and multiplayer modes. Because the game is founded on the most simplistic of RTS rules it serves as a fantastic gateway into the genre. Therefore, if you have ever wanted to play an RTS but have felt uncertain as to whether you would enjoy it or intimidated by the big names then this may be the game for you.

[h1]Tutorial[/h1]

The single-player campaign mode starts with a well-presented and implemented tutorial. The game goes through each of the fundamental mechanics that the game is built upon. It is very thorough while affording the player the opportunity to make mistakes along the way. For each mechanic, there are two levels. The first teaches the player the mechanic with the second making the player put the lesson into action. If, at any time, it seems like you have screwed up you can forfeit and restart the match. There is no penalty for doing this and you shouldn't feel bad if you have to restart once or twice.

[h1]Short Rounds[/h1]

Once you have completed the tutorial it is time for you to discover one of the facts of the game. That is that the individual matches or rounds themselves are only intended to last for approximately five minutes or so. I have seen comparisons of Interloper being the RTS equivalent to Hearthstone. It is primarily in the simplicity of gameplay and the anticipated shortness of matches where I believe this to be most fitting.

This places a significant importance on the opening moves of each round. You can quickly find yourselves in a potential match determining position. The simplest mistake early can have those types of consequences. This is both a strength and a weakness of the game. It is a strength because it rewards players who are able to implement successful strategy immediately. However, it is a weakness because matches tend to go one way or the other extremely quickly. I have yet to see many matches where the player who got out of the blocks quickly didn't end up winning the game. This is in regards to games that I have played myself as well as watched.

[h1]Two Weaknesses[/h1]

There are two very identifiable weaknesses on top of the early gameplay often determining the winner of a match. The first of these is that the game requires greater numbers in online play. Although I enjoyed spending time with the campaign the AI can only go so far. The multiplayer games are fast and furious fun when you can find a match. The other problem that I have with the game is something that can be easily solved. That is that I'd like to see a greater number and variety of maps. There are currently thirteen that can be played with. If this number increased to about twenty that would be fantastic.

[h1]Is it Steamified?[/h1]

Interloper makes fantastic use of Steam's features. There are trading cards (9) and achievements (20). The title also makes use of the Steam leaderboard system. Furthermore, the game also makes use of cross-platform play.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

Interloper should appeal to many people. Firstly, f you're a fan of RTS games and don't have time to play those that seemingly take forever to play then the short matches here should appeal. Secondly, if you haven't played an RTS and are unsure as to whether you would enjoy it then you could definitely do much worse than trying your luck with this one. You may just open yourself up to an entire genre that is bursting at the seams with outstanding titles.

For similar reviews and your chance to win great giveaways please visit [url=http://www.steamified.com]Steamified[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198271347800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1531879947}
review:
Interloper is a unique, beautiful and fast-paced RTS game in which you control a tribe of alien fish with the goal of capturing more territory than a rival tribe of alien fish.  Your main character is a Sentinel, which is immortal and can capture territory or go invisible and intangible.  Each map contains certain structures that can be captured.  Assemblers produce Drones, provided they are connected to a Power Source.  Drones are quick little creatures that can block the path of Sentinels and can attack other Drones.  There are also Foundries, which also require a Power Source and can convert Drones into Specialist Units such as Defenders (cost 2 Drones but have 3 HP), Snipers (cost 3 Drones, and have 1 HP, but can shoot enemies at a distance), and Destroyers (cost 4 Drones and have two arms that can be used either to attack or defend, but recharge over time).  And thatâ€™s about it.  The player who captures 75% of the territory wins.
This is one of those games that has the perfect balance between simple rules and depth of gameplay.  You do not need to memorize the stats and abilities of dozens of different units, know the full implications of different technologies, or spend hundreds of hours playing or watching game mechanics videos to understand the subtle intricacies of the game.  You can learn everything there is to know about the game in 1-2 hours, then test your skills against either the AI or other players online.  Interloper is a game of quick thinking, reflexes and strategy in which skill beats dedication and no strategy will always win.  (You may form a strategy which will usually win if you always play against different players, but once someone learns your strategy, they can come up with one to beat it.)
Features:
-	Unique, beautiful, and somewhat surreal atmosphere.
-	Single Player Tutorial/Campaign that walks you through the basics.
-	13 skirmish maps where you can play against AI or other players.
-	Public Online Multiplayer matches with a ranked leaderboard.
-	Private Online Multiplayer matches in which you can challenge your friends.
-	4 difficulty levels of AI and 4 behavior types, as well as 7 handicaps for an additional challenge.
-	Replays of all your matches are automatically saved, and you can optionally upload them so that everyone can see them.
-	Option to play skirmishes against the AI or watch replays while in the public multiplayer waiting queue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079512652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1349, 'last_played': 1634778650}
review:
I'm going to be straightforward; I love this little game. Fast-paced, very easy to learn, and quite difficult to master.

I only have two main complaints:

- Not enough people on Multiplayer
Multiplayer is a lot more fun than A.I., once you've managed to completely squash the four different expert A.I.'s, but there's simply not enough people on to play on multiplayer all the time. But once more people see the game and enjoy it, more people will be playing and it's an upward spiral from there.

- Maps
Don't get me wrong, the maps are well-balanced and perfect for match-ups, but there's only 13 of them. If there were some element to allow us to make maps, or for the developers to simply make more maps, that would leave me very satisfied. Since there are very simple components in the game, having a map-maker seems like a challenge that can be (relatively) easily accomplished.

All in all, I highly recommend this game. As an RTS player looking for a more simplistic strategy game, Interloper has done the job quite well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037524081', 'num_games_owned': 2227, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 8389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7034, 'last_played': 1469316319}
review:
[h1][b]Name: [u]Interloper[/u][/b][/h1]
[b]Developer:[/b] Monogon Games
[b]Date:[/b] 2015
[b]Genre:[/b] RTS
[b]Orientation:[/b] Multiplayer
[b]Population:[/b] Ghost Town
[b]Perspective:[/b] 2D - Top-Down
[b]Timeflow:[/b] Fast-Paced, Match-Based, Real-Time
[b]Skills:[/b] Brain + Fingers
[b]Setting:[/b] Molecular
[b]Style:[/b] -
[b]Tags:[/b] [i]1v1, Indie, No Campaign, No Story, Simplistic[/i]
[b]Model:[/b] B2P
[b]Content:[/b] Solid
[b]Platforms:[/b] PC, Mac
[b]Review:[/b]
	[i]Simple fast-paced strategy game in molecular settings. You control amoeba-like units and yourself as big immortal bulge, which can capture territory and spore-like buildings. Bulge can't fight or die, but it can phase, becoming invisible and moving through units. 
	There are no resources except power sources, which is necessary for buildings to work. Primitive units can be combined into powerful ones. In total there are only 5 units and 4 buildings, but for such kind of game it is enough I guess - you don't need more tactical depth if you just want to jump into match and kill 5 minutes or less.
	The goal is to capture the whole map. There are no different factions (only different colors), and all maps are symmetric. Even on big maps match only lasts several minutes, but is packed with unstoppable action and may make your brain boil. You better make sure all your APM and micro-control skills are sharped and ready BEFORE match begins - after it does, you will only have few seconds to warm up. 
	The game is multiplayer oriented. But singleplayer skirmish is quite fun too. There are 3 types of AI to choose from: agressive, defensive or balanced. I mainly played against balanced, and damn he is super agressive :O. And even if all AI levels below Expert are not so hard, Expert is ridiculously strong and challenging at big maps. He doesn't put up a fight, he stomps you - analyzes situation better than player does and utilizes weaknesses. And he doesn't even have any handicaps - unless you select them before match for additional challenge. There's no fog of war, map is always open and you can see games are completely fair. This AI is far from using same tactics over and over - though he may start from the same thing, throughout the game he keeps being fluent and adaptive, and doesn't mind loosing something if he sees opportunity to build bigger advantage. That's how you do a good strategic AI :)
	There is no campaign and no story or lore or motivation in this game whatsoever. What's called 'Campaign' here is just the tutorial with several missions, and takes less than an hour to complete.
	Graphics and design are okay, not disgusting and not too simple for a molecular game. Animation of territory being captured by your bulge is satisfactory as it should be and units look cute :)
	The game becomes boring really fast though, as there is not much to do: 13 skirmish maps and when you win on every map once or twice that's just it. Multiplayer was supposed to be the main part - but as for now, 8 average players online and 0.5 average player in queue... With such numbers I shouldn't recommend this game to anyone, but for the AI I will ;)
	Overall - good to try, not good to stay for long.[/i]
[b]Class: III - Dead Bread[/b]
[b]Verdict: Yes[/b]
[b]Reviewed:[/b] [i]6.26.2016[/i]
[b]Approach:[/b] Steam - PC, Steam Beta - PC
[b]Time:[/b] Couple Hours
[b]Deeds:[/b] 
[list]
	[*]1 Win In Multiplayer
	[*]1 Win @ Every Map VS Advanced AI
	[*]3 Wins VS Expert AI
[/list]

In the Sale it was worrth every fu**ing euro!

It's worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076230407', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1505479768}
review:
This game. I love it so much.
So I was in the closed beta of it, and I thought it was fun. And now that it's out of the closed beta, I still think it's fun. For someone who doesn't spend too much time on the computer, I find that the five-minute matches are excellent, as they won't take more than like 8 minutes to finish tops.
I highly recommend this game, as it's fun, easy to learn, has great controls but also has a lot of strategy involved.
9/10 would destroy even more drones with snipers.

review:
Seeing as it's on sale and i had this on my wishlist for a long while i thought why not get it, didn't expect to have so much fun crushing bots in campaign lmao.

The game is very fun and easy to learn,  it's a shame not many people play online, so i'd highly recommend getting the 2pack to have someone to play with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259317262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1587748760}
review:
This game is amazing, it's basically a mix of chess and an RTS. 

I finished the campaign and played every map in skirmish in little over 2 hours, but beware.. NO AI can prepare you for the mindgames in multiplayer.

I've only played 3 multiplayer games so far and they're pretty brutal. (same goes for the expert AI)
If you make a mistake you WILL pay for it.

#1 advice for this game: JUST DON'T MAKE A MISTAKE!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039796635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1463973675}
review:
Tentative thumbs up for this game.   Lovely graphics, easy to interpret layout, and rules you can pick up inside of 5 minutes.  Really the most minimal and simplistic a RTS game can get and still be entertaining.  Very short rounds, clean graphics, and intuituive interface, all making for a fast paced strategic game. 

... Unless you have the misfortune to end up in a stalemate reneacting the Cold War with your arms buildup and end up in a round that lasts for 40 minutes.  Which I did.  It pays to not think like an AI in this game, it seems -- Hence the Tentative Approval.

Definitely get it if:  You need a time-filling fast paced game that you can quit without feeling bad; you have a "use it, abuse it, lose it" philosophy to your gaming habits; you have a friend to play against in multiplayer.

Don't bother if:  You are a conservative strategist like yours truly and need time to figure out your next move; You aren't much into strategy games to begin with; You prefer in depth strategies to fast paced casual ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254887452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1477926247}
review:
To tell you guys the truth, I wasn't expect any good from this game in the frist place. In fact, I added Interloper to my wishlist and removed it soon, just because I thought "nah, this game doesn't looks like promising enough. I've got enough games refunded already so I'm not gonna take another wlid shot".

And of course I'm terribly wrong.

So where do I start with? This game is indeed a fast-paced strategy game, it is fast enough to complete a round within 5 minutes. It is kinda casual-ish, It won't take long to finish a round, nor have yourself an epic bloody battle for a couple hours. It does has simple controls, but the strategy is still required. You will need to make a plan, fast, like figure out what you're gonna do for this whole round in half a minute right after the start of the game, otherwise, you might lose, and the reason is you got blocked in a corner, and by the time you phased out, your opponent had took over all your territory already. 

And keep that in mind, I'm not good at RTS, but still I'm having fun in this game. I highly recommend this game, there's a sale anyway so go try it yourself, and hopely have some fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262864341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1463888302}
review: A well polished simple faster-paced RTS.  The tutorial, visuals, and controls are pretty good, and the game's mechanics are solid.  Each level takes about 5 minutes or less until yoiu know if you have the edge on the other player, fighting a losing battle, or at a stalemate.  In the end it is simply whether you control and defend more, the same, or less facilities than the opponent.  You really need to establish your plan & defenses quickly, because you'll very likely not be able to grind it out because the unit production differences is simply math at some point.  The game has more depth than initially lets on, but the tutorial walks you through each new piece of gameplay, including stronger defenders, snipers, etc.  But it still feels rather shallow coimpared to full RTS games.  In the end, I just didn't find it fun.  It was well made, ran well (on my Windows 10 Alienware Alpha on full screen 1080p on my 47" TV).  (3/5 stars)

author: {'steamid': '76561198071531076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 366, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1460480305}
review:
For FREE it's a great game. It's a pretty simple RTS with just 4 types of units. The graphics look good, the sound and the music are ok, too. You color tiles of the field by moving around your main unit, and capture buildings which produce new units, upgrade those units to 3 other types (sniper, guard and melee fighter). The game tends to get somewhat chaotic, as units may take unexpected paths (e.g. if a one-way gate is in their way, which may not be immediately visible) or travel to locations where they will die simply because you forget to update rally points for the building which creates new units. The game is pretty hectic, and actually reminded me Herzog Zwei (it was the first ever RTS game, released on Sega Megadrive a year or so before Dune 2). The campaign is pretty short, just 18 missions which I completed in a bit over half an hour. Only the last mission was difficult and required a retry because the enemy starts with a few control points already. Skirmishes are relatively easy, even with AI set on "expert". You can give AI some advantages like faster movement speed or extra units and so on.

review: I don't play very many RTS games, it's not really my genre.  That being said, I love this game.  It's simple enough for me to wrap my head around very quickly, it's challenging, and it's really quick.  I can pump out a few games in a half hour, which is plenty to de-stress.  Great game, recommended.

review:
Quick early review:

Only played 3 matches, but this is a FUUUUN game. It requires tactics and is pretty fast-paced. Lots of micromanagement keeps you on your toes.

More people should buy this game...especially at this price. 

As a RTS it's fun and entertaining...pretty much perfect and what I expected. 9/10...deducting a point because the menu on OSX requires a workaround to function. That should really get fixed!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993910299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1454547079}
review: Cooool game.A bit pricey (13$) for what it has to offer.. but very unique and well executed. Great replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043057746', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1445807195}
review:
Normally I am not into strategy games, micromanagement and stuff like that but this game catched my interest because of it's minimalistic and fluid gameplay. And I have to say - it is amazing!
The game mechanics are extremely sleek and elegant and capture the essence of strategy games: easy to learn, hard to master.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087108562', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1482276440}
review: NO ONLINE PLAYERS TO FIND:((

author: {'steamid': '76561198009181404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1637146055}
review: The game is just so awesome and innovative. I hope they will be more people playing this game and the developers pull off some new features as well!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021829666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1442804464}
review: My take on Interloper is that it is a very aethesitcally pleasing game with nice atmostphere that provides an enjoyable lite strategy experience.  The short match style forces quick thinking and reactions to stay ahead of your opponents.  I recommend this game to anyone who enjoys quick playing strategy games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992053719', 'num_games_owned': 1043, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1441819671}
review:
It's a game about using sci-fi tadpoles to cover an area in jelly! Plenty of units and maps, a low difficulty curve, and a high enough skill ceiling make this fun as hell!

Check out my video for more info~
https://youtu.be/1axFbB0prWQ

author: {'steamid': '76561198090668020', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1474020165}
review:
Awesome game!
Really love the concept, but it doesn't have much content yet.
more levels could be fun, and the computer is too easy after you understand the game.
and I haven't found someone to play against in the multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027355045', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1437846451}
review: good game, easy to learn hard to master, but the problem is : its fun and enjoyable only on multiplayer, and there are no  gamers on public match

author: {'steamid': '76561198028223224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1441408622}
review:
Exactly as promised, simple to learn but hard to master. Short matches also as stated, but you can never play just one.

Don't be fooled by the seeming slow pace of the game if you only look at gameplay videos, there is much to control at once and you won't be using just a mouse button once every 5 seconds.

Higly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045840468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1437525458}
review: Absolutely incredible. I'm blown away by the depth this game's simple mechanics provide. An absolutely beautiful RTS game that will appeal to anyone, absolutely anyone. A perfect blend of strategy and tactical gameplay which is fun and engaging from start to finish of every single match. Each and every unit and mechanic is precious and can create such value for you if used correctly. 10/10 would recommend to anyone. I haven't played anything like this before...Such an affordable game for the experience it provides. WOW.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143962709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 739, 'last_played': 1490508533}
review: Fun little 2D "zone capture" that's, as the description states, "easy to learn, difficult to master". Downside: not well known so the multiplayer is not very populated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041359022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1447895523}
review: Like the Awesomenauts of RTS. Looks easy as they simplified machanics, but still pretty comparable to other RTS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042369094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1438421636}
review: This game is an absolute blast to play and a beautifully designed RTS. It takes away a ton of the complexity of other's in the genre and yet manages to maintain a surprising amount of strategy. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking to get into RTS and for some quick battles with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079897593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1435089974}
review:
Excellent RTS game. I stumbled upon this when looking through steam RTS games and my first impression is "doesn't look like RTS". It is, rest assured. 

It's is simple and interesting. Easy to learn. Great design. The designers clearly thought outside of the box for this one and it works well. It's well designed. 

I didn't see it listed but it comes with a lot of maps -- and I personally expect more to be added. For the price, if you like RTS games, this is a good buy. I'm quite happy with it and can see this filling in some "game time holes" for that RTS itch when I don't have 20 minutes or the patience for Starcraft (or some the other longer RTSes).

** Updated ** - Originally, I noted that the game has no instruction whatsoever. This is wrong. If you select single player and select "Campaign", it walks you though everything. I'm still not sure how 'Tribe' affects things though. 

Anyway, I'll just add that a game like this should have been created a while ago. Another aside, I love the art and music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025456195', 'num_games_owned': 649, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1432672530}
review:
Interloper is a beautifully executed, fantastically original take on the RTS paradigm.

This game does away with all the pomp and bloat of contemporary RTSs and presents a concise, compact and expertly balanced competitive tactical scenario.

We have a top-down view of a largely grid-based map, each player commands a single primary unit which is used to capture terrain and buildings. Capturing around 70% of the map wins you the game.
There are three buildings. Assemblers build a second type of unit: Drones. Drones are front-line defensive and offensive soldiers, blocking the primary terrain grabbing unit's path and thereby forming defensive front-lines and, with the benefit of numbers, destroying the opponents front-lines and opening gaps fro the terrain-grabber. Foundries consume drones to create three more specialist units which have varying advantages over drones and increase the tactical depth many-fold. Both these buildings require power from captured Power Sources, the third building type.

Despite its simplicity, the range of scenarios you can run into over different games, even on the same map, are diverse and thrilling. The majority of games are fast-paced land-grabs initially and evolve into high pressure management of various choke-points and front-line standoffs. These games favour the bold, the tactically nimble and the quick thinkers. Oftentimes a slower paced pseudo-stalemate can arise from these frantic situations where both players gain a stable foothold on the map and foster similarly powerful defensive lines and economies. Such stalemates, however, are no less tense, no less exciting and no less tactical. Indeed, any foothold you think you have gained may be at risk of crumbling dramatically in the face of a smarter opponent.

Ultimately, Interloper is a breath of fresh air in the RTS genre. It has the potential to become a fantastically balanced and meaningful competitive game if the multiplayer scene kicks off. It is a RNGless, pure-skill game much like a real-time Chess and it shares Chess' beautiful dichotomy of being mechanically simple yet tactically fathoms deep!

If you're looking for THE new kid on the competitive RTS block, buy this game now, buy copies for your friends, come join our burgeoning community at http://forum.monogongames.com and come meet the small but wonderful development team who ACTUALLY talk to us and ACTUALLY play the game with us! With the excellent competitive following this game is sure to foster, it will soon be a force to be reckoned with!
Happy Interloping!

author: {'steamid': '76561198156591170', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1465154056}
review:
Reposting a new review, in order to maybe draw some attention. Interloper is a fast strategic rts. It can end in a matter of minutes, you must learn to counter opponents, while planning your next move. Alot has improved since the betas, now a very nice campaign mode with 18 levels to get you started, and then a skirmish mode with the bot if you want to practice more before multiplayer. Right now it's sometimes hard to get a match, as not alot of people know about this game. Only 150-180 reviews, all very postive though as it's amazing. We need to Spread the word! buy and love this, get your friends

Reasons to buy:
Good Community
Great developers! always fixing things and very fast on replies in forums
Beautifulll Graphics
Addictive gameplay
easy to learn, hard to master. 
Pick up and Drop: 5 min matches mean you can pick it up while waiting for something, play your match in less then 5 mins, and then do what you wanted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030965036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1624166706}
review: This game is great although more people need to know about it as the multiplayer isn't full at all. The best comparison for this game is a mind board game like checkers or chess. Outwitting your opponent and micromanaging to an extent it the name of the game although tunnel vision can end your game before you know it. Graphics are perfect for the game it is and the soundtrack enhances the experience. Small additions to the game make it strangely addicting and the games are short enough not to become repetitive. Its downside is the lack of decent AI(i have not tried the hardest difficulty) and the campaign is just a tutorial which is fine but I feel a campaign might have been nice since multiplayer is dead right now. OVerall this game is great for spending downtime and is worth the money. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198056788787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1499450662}
review: If you're the kind of person who loves strategy games but can't really devote hours of your time to play them, Interloper is perfect for you. The rules are simple, the units and buildings are few, but the strategy is quite deep. I've been playing this since the Beta came out and I just can't get enough of it. The only problem I have is that the AI isn't very competitive. I'm waiting for more players to start playing the game online so I can get some decent competition.

review: Muuuuuito legal, Ã© um jogo de estratÃ©gia parecido com a mecÃ¢nica de Starcraft/Warcraft, porem Ã© mais rapido e simples (easy to learn and hard to master), vale muito a pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042485166', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1458458519}
review:
Basically, you play as a big sperm, move around to weird sperm bases, capture said sperm bases, make tiny sperm to defend your current sperm, then you can make robotics and lasers out of the tiny sperms to kill the other person's tiny sperm.

The game is an incredible fast paced RTS that is like a mini mixture of the strategy of a simplified Civ 5, the art and music of an outstanding indie title, and the speed of a checkers match. The blend of simultaneous play between players conjoined with battle tactics that are so simple, yet so hard to employ makes this game a unique star in the RTS genre.

So I'd say buy it, maybe on sale (you should really buy all things on sale), get one for your pal and get flustered when he punches your sperm with a robot made of other sperms.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053447856', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1435436621}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015349362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1463516403}
review:
Interloper is an innovative, fun, and deep yet balanced game for anyone who's into RTS games. 

Though it might seem slow and overly simple at first glance, there's actually more depth to it than any other RTS game I have ever played, and I was very happy to find that there were maps [i]without[/i] special units because they actually made it too complex for me in the beginning! I'm sure that RTS veterans should be able to find tonnes of different strategies for each game, and - though also fun for beginners - the game seems to be targeted more at that (more serious) audience.

The best thing about all this though, is that matches take so little time, so you're inclined to try again and get better at the game in a Spelunky-type fashion, instead of feeling like you just wasted 2 hours playing a lost game.

What I'd like to see in the future (and from what I gather on the forum this [u]is[/u] coming) is a 2v2 or 4-player free for all game mode, so I can play with more friends to see who is the best strategist. I think that would also make the game a lot more fun to more novice players - and it's a great way to introduce your friends to the game without immediately having to crush them.

[b]So whether you're an ex- Age of Empires expert with too little time to play, or if you're an RTS enthusiast, definitely pick this game up![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198007121032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1552872582}
review: Great game! Trimmed down rts to a chess-like purity.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999930331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1496017455}
review:
Haven't had time to play interloper much since the release, but i could recommend this game to anyone. In particular to gamers who love strategy games but, as myself, don't usually have the time to play 30-60 minutes at once. 
Interloper has everything a good RTS needs (special units, different structures to capture/use etc). 
It's really easy to get into, but hard to master! (yeah, that's sort of what the trailer says, and it's true)

Besides that, it runs smooth and has a good feel to it. Love the art-style and music too!

review: Got five minutes? Interloper really is that fast of a game, but it still has tons of strategy. Just because it's pretty and has creatures with flagellums doesn't mean it's not awesome - there are sniping creatures, tanky things, power plants, what else do you need in an RTS?

author: {'steamid': '76561197998608148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1432047926}
review:
It's RTS stripped to the bone: no fat, no boring stats and certainly no boring tanks. There ARE giant sperm mice, though.

Review video: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QxI5o0vKXaA

The surprise with this game is how beautiful and relaxed it appears on first contact, but half way into a match you'll be tearing your hair out trying to simultaneously claim new territory, steal back old territory, repairing broken power lines, moving your drones between attack and defence, making more drones etc. A casual glance at gameplay footage won't make you truly appreciate the number of mad calculations you'll need to do every second.

The maps don't vary enormously and there's a finite amount of elements to play with, but then chess only has one 'map' and that game seems to do okay for itself!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993517230', 'num_games_owned': 829, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1432251640}
review:
If you want a fun and easily approached RTS, I definitely recommend it. The art style and sound design really bring you in while the simple mechanics get you involved.

When you take that all in and add in the short matches, amazing depth of play, and included multi-player, you get a good package.

Click here to see it in action --> [url=http://youtu.be/3WxK2uvFPvE]Gameplay Footage [/url]

I tend to consider it like real time chess with a biological theme.

Also, the drones look like scifi war sperm. What's not to love? :D
